message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with pattern recognition in images and graphs, which suggests that it could belong to several sub-categories. However, the focus on convolutional neural networks and their extension to non-vectorial and semi-structured data, as well as the experiments conducted on action recognition datasets, suggest that cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The use of new design principles and pooling operators also suggests that the paper could belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), or cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the emphasis on graph-laplacians and their combinations suggests that the paper could also belong to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
